Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the expert's investigation found that the incidents provided by Rep. Ron Paul's campaign did not align with the claim made.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there were not as many suicide attacks every month since 9/11 as there were in all the years leading up to 9/11, as evidenced by the expert's investigation.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that there have been as many suicide attacks every month since 9/11 as there were in all the years leading up to 9/11, without providing sufficient evidence.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of suicide attacks against the United States and its allies every month since 9/11 by comparing it to the number of attacks in all the years leading up to 9/11.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it is not supported by accurate information or evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
